definition:
Given an integer $m$ consisting of $k$ digits $d_1, \dots, d_k$ in base
$b$, let $$j = \prod_{i = 1}^{k} d_i,$$ then repeat this operation on
the digits of $j$ until $j < b$. This stores in $j$ the [*multiplicative
digital root*]{} of $m$. The number of iterations of the multiplication
operation is called the [*multiplicative persistence*]{} of $m$.
